name: Chords
description: Musical chord progression generator.

name: Magic
description: A simple Google Analytics dashboard.

name: CourseLetter
description: Email course platform.

name: Launch the Damn MVP
description: A list of historical MVP's.
lessons: #nocode! Let's see what people think about this idea :).

name: Match
description: Intelligent, autonomous match-making between two datasets.
stack: React, Recoil, Google OAuth, GCP, Google Sheets API, Node

name: Hacker Promos
description: Promo deals for the hacker community.
lessons: This project has made me hop on the #nocode bandwagon. Perfect for validating an idea. I need to stop diving right into building, and validate ideas first.

name: Desk Tour
description: Platform to share your desk and the products you use on it.
stack: React, Redux, Express, GraphQL, MongoDB, GCP, Cloudinary API, Rainforest API, Auth0, Node
lessons: You gotta really give a crap about whatever you work on (especially when a salary is not on the line). Otherwise, you will not care enough to work on it when things get inevitably hard. UPDATE: Got featured in a press article!!! https://theamericangenius.com/editorials/pinterest-for-wfh-desk-setups/
results: ~10k visits after launch, 15 posts of UGC, 50+ users registered

name: Personal Website
description: What you're looking at right now.

name: What time today?
description: Summarize your time availability in seconds.
stack: React, Redux, Google Calendar API, GCP, Google OAuth
lessons: Deploy and get your solution in front of people asap. Solving your own problems is almost cheating. Keep dev cycles as short as humanly possible.
results: 6k+ visits after launch, ~60 monthly visits, ~80 Google Calendar users.

name: Artificial Art
description: GAN image synthesis for landscape art.
stack: Google Colab, Jupyter Notebook, scikit-learn, Keras, Tensorflow, Matplotlib
lessons: Research is a whole different beast. To get SOTA, first replicate results. ML is even more frustrating than I previously experienced.
results: A good grade in the class, and some crappy images.

name: DynaML
description: Research toolkit to simulate graphs.
lessons: Again, hackathons are still full of BS.
results: 4th place at HackRice. 1st place for Facebook Algorithmic Complexity Challenge.

name: FTWL Website
description: Website for a Houston non-profit, Friends of Texas Wildlife.
stack: React, HTML, CSS, Contentful API, Heroku
lessons: Again, keep feedback loops tight - crazy how much this can make/break a project. Surprising how difficult leadership in a software dev setting is.

name: News Sentiment
description: An attempt to extract company stock correlated sentiment from news articles.
lessons: It's exhausting to build stuff that isn't useful.
stack: Python, Jupyter Notebook, Tensorflow, Keras, Pandas, NLTK, GCP

name: Rackr
description: A receipt scanning and personal finance tracking iOS app.
results: 1st place at the Capital One Software Engineering Summit

name: Hedwig
description: An on-campus food delivery platform for Rice.
stack: React Native, MongoDB, GraphQL, Redux, Node

name: SER Jobs
description: Revamp SER Houston's digital application process.

name: LA Bike-Share Data Analysis
description: Analysis and visualization of LA bike-share data.
results: Able to attend the Capital One Engineering Summit.
lessons: Use pandas. If many people use something, it's likely for a reason.

name: News Visualization
description: A network of political figures mentioned in news articles.

name: Hangman / Length Converter
description: Two silly Google Chrome extensions.

name: RiceSlang
description: A Slackbot to explain popular Rice slang terms.
